intro: Saussurea broussonetiifolia, commonly known as the Tibetan corydalis, is a flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of the Himalayas. It belongs to the family Asteraceae and is characterized by its compact growth habit and showy, daisy-like flowers. The plant typically produces yellow to orange composite flowers that bloom in late summer. Its leaves are basal, forming a rosette, and are often covered in fine hairs. Saussurea broussonetiifolia is adapted to cold, arid environments and is often found in alpine meadows.
